Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately identify and illustrate two different habitats, ensuring one is a land habitat (e.g., forest) and the other is a water habitat (e.g., ocean).
The student can successfully draw a wide variety of living things, including both plants and animals, that are realistically found in the land habitat (e.g., trees, squirrels, birds).
The student can depict a diverse array of living things in the water habitat, correctly representing both aquatic plants and animals (e.g., fish, seaweed, coral).
The student can clearly illustrate and compare the differences in the living things between the two habitats, showing understanding of unique adaptations and organisms.
The student can demonstrate patterns by showcasing a diversity of life forms in each habitat, indicating an awareness of ecosystem complexity and biodiversity.
CANNOT: (Occasional) Forget to label some elements fully or leave out specific names for certain organisms even though they are accurately drawn (e.g., a drawn oak tree is not labeled as 'oak').

(Minor) May not capture every detail of specific habitats' environmental features (e.g., underwater currents or seasonal changes) but still conveys a clear understanding of habitat types and inhabitants.
